visualization_prompt: Generate a line chart showing synthetic metric fluctuations using interactive annotations anchored to pixel coordinates and data values
visualization_explanation: The dataset contains 12 univariate numerical observations representing sequential measurements. Synthetic values (μ=125.1, σ=55.3) show non-stationary behavior with local maxima at positions 3 and 8. The line chart maximizes data-ink ratio by eliminating redundant gridlines while maintaining temporal progression. Annotations follow Cairo's salience principles through contrasting colors and positional offsetting. Pixel-based coordinate references in secondary annotations demonstrate Highcharts' dual-scale capabilities. The 0.5-interval x-axis grid enhances spatial reasoning while the blue series color maintains perceptual distinctness.
